title: What is the meaning of the graph showing the cycle and the fusion of action and reaction in a purely intellectual perception?
first_phrase: This text explores the concept of consciousness and perception, highlighting the different forms that it can take. In the last 200 tokens, it describes a case in which the cycle of action and reaction merges into a purely intellectual perception, with no physiological correspondences. This form of consciousness is characterized by immediate identification with essence, and a direct perception of the unity of the self. The text also mentions the perception of beings and forces that are not visible in physical fields and concludes by localizing a schematic field of normal external consciousness. The text references works by authors such as E.C. Agrippa and Plotinus to support its arguments.

last_phrase: In summary, the case presented in this chapter describes an advanced state of consciousness that involves the direct perception of the essence of the self, beyond any physical, emotional, or intellectual modifications. This form of consciousness is characterized by immediate identification and a becoming essence, rather than stimulus and reaction. Understanding these concepts can provide insight into achieving a higher level of consciousness and self-awareness.
